TopicTitle: Grid Fins and Super Heavy Landing Legs in Kerbal Space Program

Articles.Content: What do you think, guys(from Squad too), about add Grid Fins for more realistic stock reusable (mostly) rockets  and Super Heavy Landing Legs for Heavier Landers?

Well, if you don't mind mods, well...

I'm pretty sure Necrobones has large landing legs in at least one of his mods, Roverdude's sounding rockets mod has grid fins, and I think SXT might have grid fins.

No guarantee that the grid fins work with FAR; I suspect FAR would voxelize them as bricks and not properly handle them.
If I understand correctly, all the current mod gridfins are "cheaty" because the current aero model doesn't properly handle them.
I know that there are some mods for it for example Kerbal Reusability Expansion and I have it, but I want it to be stock.

I agree that the stock game needs this kind of thing. Landing our ultra-mega-super-huge ITS and F9R replicas is quite difficult when we have to land on the engine bells and make do with itty-bitty airbrakes that for some reason can only handle 1200K when opened :\

On 04/30/17 at 10:33 PM, Capt. Hunt said:

If I understand correctly, all the current mod gridfins are "cheaty" because the current aero model doesn't properly handle them.

It's not the aero, it's the part.  You can't really have a collision mesh with the complexity of a grid fin.  Instead of a grid, it simply becomes a flat piece like any other control surface and the "air" cannot flow through the grid.
